text:
Hello (hope I’m asking at the right place)
I saw this question has been asked by doing a research but no clear answer has been given.
I have 6 different blogs and I’m building a global page overview of the posts.
There are two filters on this page, one for the blogs themselves (called category) and another one for the tags.
The problem is that the tags are filtering per blog and not globally, I would like to regroup all the tags whatever blogs they’re coming from.
I currently have something like this: <http://websitename.com/blogname/tag/tagname|websitename.com/blogname/tag/tagname> wish to have <http://websitename.com/tag/blog|websitename.com/tag/blog> , is that possible? Thank you for your help!

So I am using aos (Animate on Scroll) library on some CMS templates. It works on this coded template (<https://www.smoothiebox.com/benefits>) but doesn't work on this drag and drop template (<https://www.smoothiebox.com/>). Can anyone see what is wrong with the drag and drop page?
It may be related to the console errors. I would try fixing those first and seeing if that resolves your issue.
Hello, does anyone know if this log is normal? Or how to solve it? It looks like it's related to permission to use inline styles. Thanks in advance.

The Content Security Policy 'default-src 'none'; script-src 'self'; connect-src 'self'; img-src 'self'; style-src 'self';base-uri 'self';form-action 'self'' was delivered in report-only mode, but does not specify a 'report-uri'; the policy will have no effect. Please either add a 'report-uri' directive, or deliver the policy via the 'Content-Security-Policy' header.

[Report Only] Refused to apply inline style because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "style-src 'self'". Either the 'unsafe-inline' keyword, a hash ('sha256-j0bVhc2Wj58RJgvcJPevapx5zlVLw6ns6eYzK/hcA04='), or a nonce ('nonce-...') is required to enable inline execution.
